Event.name: Meet_with
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame <fen>Party_1</fen> meets with <fen>Party_2</fen> at a prearranged <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>. If expressed, <fen>Purpose</fen> only applies to <fen>Party_1</fen>. The <fen>Purpose</fen> of the meeting is usually discussion over a certain topic. <ex><fex name="Party_1">I</fex> <t>met with</t> <fex name="Party_2">my professor</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to talk about my midterm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Party_1
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the meeting event. It can refer to either a single individual or a larger party separate from <fen>Party_2</fen> before the meeting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Party_2
Arg.definition: <def-root>A grammatically less prominent participant in the meeting event. It can refer to either a single individual or a larger party separate from <fen>Party_1</fen> before the meeting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action that <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen> plan to engage in upon meeting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> descibes the way in which <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen> convene.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the meeting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of <fen>Party_1</fen> or <fen>Party_2</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: meet with.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together and discuss
